content.description: Squat start matched on the giant shelf hold found on the roof. Pull on and compress the arete with the right hand and some pinches out left for the other hand. A hard move to the lip gains a positive hold and then keep it together for a few smacks up to more positive holds for the topout.
content.protection: 3-4. Landing is a bit awkward. There is also a spike on the far leftside that could potentially be hazardous.
content.location: This problem is found on the roof of the large boulder that is sitting in the depression.

content.description:
Sit start in the small cave, smack up to some pinches and bad slopers and figure out how to mantle on to the slab. This problem starts inside a small but really deep cave.

 Â The full low, starting deep inside the cave is a dabby project.
content.protection: padding situation is a bit awkward. 2 pads and a slider/ briefcase.
content.location: This problem is found at the backside of the Pit Stop. To the right of the obvious right to left sloping lip traverse. It is found in a little pit where a deep cave is hidden from view.

content.description: Stand start the arete with a decent left hand edge and a right hand edge slightly lower. Find a foot and power out to the sloping lip of the overhang out right, figure out how to match and then top it out.
content.location: This problem is found in the backside of the Pit Stop. This boulder is the one just left of the roof which houses "Twilight Tour" and "Assembly Lane".

content.description:
Sit or squat start matched on the sloping lip of the boulder. Traverse friendly slopers out left to the apex and top out. Fun open hand climbing in a neat little alcove.

 This problem does not start in the small cave/pit.
content.protection: 3 pads. landing is a bit funky. There is a wobbly tree that can be repositioned if it is in the way.
content.location: This problem is found in the back of the Pit Stop Area. "Nitro Fueled" and "C.T.R." share the same topout.

content.description: Sit or squat start with a left hand mini pinch on the arete and a right hand sidepull pinch on the steep overhang. Compress the juice out of the two holds and make a hard smack up to a textured shelf. Match this shelf with difficulty and figure out how to mantle the boulder.
content.protection: 2 pads. There is a spike to the left and behind you. The one to the left did not prove to be dangerous.
content.location: This climb is found on the left side of the steep overhanging boulder/ roof that is home to the classic "Twilight Tour".

content.description: Squat start matched on the large shelf found on the roof of the boulder as for "Twilight Tour", but instead of climbing up the overhang compressing the sidepulls and the arete, smack out right to a sloper before getting a hand heel match on the starting shelf in order to gain a sloping knob found on the arete. Once here, figure out how to reach the large sloping hold several feet up. (Hint: there is a decent crimp intermediate) Once on this sloping hold, match and move up to improving holds on the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: landing is a bit uneven and blocky. 3-4 pads ideally.
content.location: This climb is on the steep roof. "Twilight Tour" follows the overhang up, while this one moves right and exits up the face.

content.description: This is a secluded area that is a great spot to hang out with the crew and try some obscure classic V5 compression climbs. There are a few projects left in the area and a few warm-up climbs as well.
